page.title: 18ROYAL CELEBRATIONS: SHAWHEAD
page.content: Mr Learmont, a senior citizen living in Shawhead, remembers when King George VI was crowned in 1937. The people of the parish celebrated with sports such as running races, tug o' war and five-a-side football. Every child received a coronation mug. Queen Elizabeth II was crowned in 1953 and that was a great celebration. People watched it on the television but only 3 houses had televisions: the Learmonts, the Johnstones and the Proudlocks. They thought that it would not be very good reception but it was. They had small black and white screens. After the programme there was a bonfire up on the Doons which is a big hill and the fire could be seen for miles around. The Queen's Silver Jubilee was in 1977. There were sports and pony rides and the children got a jubilee crown.
